üìä Solana Tests $145 Again - Breakout or Another Rejection?     $SOL  has rebounded sharply from sub-$135 levels and is once again pressing into the $141‚Äì$145 resistance zone - a range that has capped upside multiple times since November 2025. Historically, each test triggered 15‚Äì16% pullbacks. This time, however, the correction has been limited to just 3‚Äì4%, hinting at improving buyer resilience.     From a technical standpoint, the structure looks constructive. SOL is trading above its 20, 50, 100, and 200 moving averages, a configuration not seen since September 2025. On lower timeframes, price is testing the neckline of a potential double-bottom formation, while RSI remains elevated, suggesting sustained momentum rather than exhaustion.     That said, on-chain data introduces caution. Network growth has slowed meaningfully: weekly new wallet creation has dropped from ~30M at its peak to ~7M recently. Previous $SOL  rallies were closely tied to expanding user participation, and without a rebound in network activity, upside attempts near $145 risk losing follow-through.     A high-volume daily close above $145 would mark a structural shift and open the path toward $165‚Äì$180. Failure to break could keep SOL locked in a broader range, with deeper pullbacks still on the table. For now, Solana sits at a familiar decision zone - momentum is improving, but confirmation is still required.    #Solana  #SOL  #Altcoin Season#  #Altcoin Season#

Here are the latest and greatest updates we shipped to Banana Pro this week:

General
üçåDeployed additional performance optimizations, making the platform even faster.
üçåImproved currency formatting.
üçåRemoved old Pending Orders widget with the legacy Wallet widget.

Wallet Widget
üçåNewly created and imported wallets are structured correctly under the appropriate blockchain.
üçåResolved wallet-import issues; refined the visual design.
üçåAdded transfer success and failure notifications.

Buy/Sell
üçåBuying flow is newly connected to user-defined presets; users can configure this in settings.
üçåFixed a bug affecting the display of the USD value; the confirmation button now shows the correct amount in dollars.

Notifications
üçåNotifications now appear faster.
üçåAdded a new notification for sell actions.
üçåFixed issue making incorrect notifications appear with wrong values.

Search
üçå All token history is now saved and stored correctly in the Search section.
üçå Added a NEW Quick Buy feature to Search, which allows users to make purchases with a single click.
üçå Improved the repeated data loading within Search, making the refresh process more reliable and consistent.

Login & Authorization
üçåOption to sign in with your wallet is now available.
üçåImproved WalletConnect implementation.

Positions, Orders, Copy Trade
üçåPosition widget now includes a column indicating which blockchain you hold the given position on.
üçåActive orders have expanded with multi-chain logic; check Solana and Base active orders simultaneously.

Wallet Tracker
üçå Added @base token support.
üçå Improved loading speed.

DCA & Limits
üçå Added order details localization and enhanced the DCA details component with translation support.

Presets
üçåProgressed with a preset feature allowing users to configure unique presets in settings.

Mobile Responsiveness
üçå Updated the Orders view for mobile with refinements to the header.

This is where our art director @holasoymolly came in üíú.

Throughout the process, we also shared early versions with our Telegram community and listened carefully to feedback as we were building.

RODAI has always been community driven, and it was important that this new identity reflected that from the start.
And this is the result.

A logo system that finally gives RODAI the foundation it needs to scale across products, platforms, merch, NFTs, and everything that comes next.
